title: Biomedical Data Scientist
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title Biomedical Data ScientistRequisition Number RE44896Working TitleDepartment Name 7P180:DEPT OF BIOSTATISTICSWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 47Salary Range $56,596-93,358/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationMSClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related Experience1 yrRequired License/Registration/CertificationNonePhysical RequirementsOccasional lifting up to 15 pounds. Sitting at computer workstation for extended periods. Repetitive motion.ShiftMonday–Friday 8:00am – 5:00pm, additional hours when needed to meet department needs.Job SummaryThe Department of Biostatistics seeks a data scientist with healthcare, computational, and informatics expertise. This position will design and direct innovative solutions for data products used in exploratory data analyses, generating and testing hypotheses, analyzing and mining biomedical data. The data scientist will collaborate on extramural-funded projects to offer innovative, expert-level Biostatistical and Biomedical Data Science expertise in study design and consultation in data analysis and interpretation after study implementation.The data scientist will develop, direct and oversee implementation of project protocols that involve complex data systems, data linkage and capture, programmatic statistical analysis and software development, data management and visualization, database construction and maintenance. As a lead for data science, the position will actively promote and direct the service mission for biostatistics, data science, and biomedical informatics on a regional, national, and/or global scale.Please note: A cover letter is required to complete the application process. A Statement of research interest must be included in the letter.Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesDoes this position have supervisory responsibilities? title: Data Scientist II
job_description: Posting DetailsJob Title Data Scientist IIRequisition Number RE44086Working Title Data ScientistDepartment Name 40502:Institute for Biomedical InformaticsWork Location Lexington, KYGrade Level 47Salary Range $56,596-93,358/yearType of Position StaffPosition Time Status  Full-TimeRequired EducationMSClick here for more information about equivalencies: https://hr.uky.edu/employment/working-uk/equivalenciesRequired Related Experience5 yrsRequired License/Registration/CertificationNonePhysical RequirementsSitting for long periods of time.ShiftMonday – Friday; 8:00 am-5:00 pmJob SummaryThe Institute for Biomedical Informatics is looking for a Data Scientist II to join our team! This position will be primarily responsible for performing statistical analysis on large healthcare data sets to uncover insights that improve patient care and outcomes, identify important relationships and trends, and communicate findings to the University and scientific community. This position has the following responsibilities:Collect, organize and analyze complex healthcare data from sources such as electronic health records, insurance claims, clinical trials, and registriesBuild predictive models and machine learning algorithms to derive insights from healthcare dataInterpret findings from statistical analyses and quantitative research and effectively communicate results to key stakeholdersIdentify opportunities to expand data collection to support health outcomes research initiativesStay current on developments in data science, methods and best practices for health outcomes researchDocument all data preparation and analysis code thoroughly for reproducibilityThis position will work closely with staff and faculty to complete analysis, develop reports, collaborate in writing journal articles, and attend and present at national meetings. The Data Scientist should be familiar with various data management and BI reporting tools. The position will utilize leadership skills to lead meetings and oversee statistical analyses conducted by graduate research students and staff members.This position will offer flexibility for a fully, on-campus schedule or a hybrid schedule with three days on-campus and two days remote.We value work-life balance and want you to have the flexibility you need to do both. As a University of Kentucky employee, you will be entitled to amazing health insurance options, employee discounts, and a 200% retirement match! Starting your first day, you will annually accrue 3 weeks of paid vacation, 12 sick days, and 10 holidays.Apply today and see why we were named among the nation’s top 10 large employers by Forbes magazine!Skills / Knowledge / AbilitiesProficiency with R, SAS , SQL , and TableauDoes this position have supervisory responsibilities?  NoPreferred Education/ExperiencePhD preferredDeadline to Apply 05/06/2024University Community of InclusionThe University of Kentucky is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by ensuring all our students, faculty, and staff work in an environment of openness and acceptance. title: Data Scientist - Services Customer Enablement
job_description: As a Lexmark Data Scientist you will work as a part of the Services Customer Enablement team. Customer Enablement is responsible for the support web experiences and content to answer technical questions our customers or partners may have related to Lexmark’s products and their usage. Enabling customer and partners to find answers is part of self-service. Doing this when they need, on their device of preference, in their language, enables us to personalize their experience and resolve a pain point on their terms, without having to contact Lexmark.The Data Scientist will collaborate with various functional teams and stakeholders throughout Lexmark to identify opportunities to leverage company data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of service delivery, product development, and business strategies. Provide support to the development and business area communities for Lexmark data sources, data visualization / dashboards and analysis.  Investigate how to leverage GenAI tools to provide value for content lifecycle management and or search functionality.Skills The skillset to be used in the job are listed below. A strong candidate will have a good foundation in some or all these areas plus the desire to learn the others. Machine Learning, Deep Learning GenAI / LLM familiarity  Statistics  Programming (likely Python, R, SQL)  Data visualization (likely PBI, JMP)  Database and data structures familiarity  Data querying skills (likely SQL)  Communication & organizational skills   Role Requirements:Collaboration with cross functional business areas regarding the research and testing of GenAI tools for support website experience for end users or skilled field technicians. Evaluate the use of GenAI to improve efficiency of Content Authoring team to maintain accuracy and relevance of content on support websites; including leveraging case history from Dynamics (CRM) Manage data tools and visualizations for Service Training. Enabling team to connect training effectiveness to individual performance in field. Work with cross-functional Lexmark team resources to rapidly develop proof of concepts based on business area provided data Blend methodologies from machine learning, applied statistics, and operations research in order to distill complex and disparate data sources into value-added information streams accessible by non-technical staff Create interactive applications and visualizations that empower our workforce to discover advanced analytics without becoming a data scientist Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor of Science in Physics, Math, Statistics, Economics, Chemistry, Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields or direct related experience Computing programming skills & experience such as Python, R, SQL/noSQL, Demonstrated experience with experimental design, sampling methodology, Bayesian inference, generalized linear models, hierarchical modeling, unsupervised learning (factor analysis/principal components/clustering), shrinkage methods (ridge/lasso), decision trees and deep learning. Experience with Cloud Platforms such as Azure File Storage, Azure Databricks, is a plus. General printer business domain knowledge is a plus. How to Apply ?Are you an innovator? Here is your chance to make your mark with a global technology leader. Apply now!We are proudly an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.Global Privacy Notice Lexmark is committed to appropriately protecting and managing any personal information you share with us. Click here to view Lexmark's Privacy Notice.

title: Front-End Web Developer
job_description: Summary Of Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesProvides assistance to the Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing in developing the Murray State website, digital marketing initiatives, and administration of the content management system.Assists in providing digital content that communicates with prospective students and clients. Works with Director of Web Management and Digital Marketing to develop new features and page templates in CMS , using XML and EXSLT . Additional duties as assigned.

title: Reliability Engineer
job_description: Roles:Provide mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation engineering support. Primary areas include developing and maintaining; reliability programs, Root Cause Problem Elimination (RCPE), preventive and predictive maintenance programs, troubleshooting and project sponsorship. Demonstrates a positive teamwork attitude on a consistent basis.  ResponsibilitiesSupports Safety and Environmental Policies:Adheres to Century safety policies. Support company’s environmental policies and assures that the environmental impact of changes to processes, equipment, and materials are evaluated.  Improves Equipment and Process Reliability:Provide reliability expertise and actively promote a culture of reliability. Performs Root Cause Problem Elimination (RCPE), including follow-up actions and recommendations.Develop new or improve existing preventive and predictive maintenance procedures.Defines, leads and coordinates maintenance work and projects.Stay up to date on reliability and maintenance best practices. Drive equipment improvements based on reliability data. Identify opportunities to improve equipment condition monitoring.  Supports Operations and Maintenance:High level process/equipment troubleshooting. Lead and/or sponsor improvement projects. Maintain an effective working relationship with personnel at all levels of the organization. Provide professional communication through presentations, reports and status updates.Generate ideas for improvements of processes and equipment. Analyze spare parts requirements and identify obsolete or excess spare parts.Provide engineering support.Drives precision maintenance and permanent repairs over temporary fixes Bachelor’s degree in Maintenance/Engineering field required, Master’s preferred. Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a reliability role engaged in manufacturing preferred. An ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of six sigma tools, root cause analysis techniques, preventative maintenance methodologies, and SAP pant maintenance information system. The candidate will possess the ability to partner with plant engineers, planners, supervisors and technicians – thus, interpersonal communication is critical to success.

title: Test Engineer
job_description: The Test Engineer’s primary duty is to develop, implement, release and maintain test systems that ensure products perform their proposed functions in an acceptable manner. Developing and supporting internal test systems as well as supporting customer supplied test systems (ICT – In-Circuit Test and FICT – Functional In-Circuit Test) are critical requirements for this role. This role is also responsible for using statistical methods to identify recurring problems and give detailed reports on defects. Essential Functions:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Develops, supports, and implements ICT and FICT.Supports/implements customer supplied test systems.Using current industry standards, writes software to exercise units under functional test or in-circuit test and programs firmware into IC’s.Writes software to store and retrieve test results in a manufacturing execution system.Develops and Releases test instructions.Implements and manages revision and change control on tester hardware, software, test instructions, and other documentation associated with tester development.Validates tester hardware and software functions correctly before release to manufacturing.Performs ongoing quality assurance on tester hardware and software to ensure systems function as designed.Coordinates with the customer engineering group during quoting process on new prospective products.Uses precision test equipment to test and trouble shoot boards.Works with manufacturing engineering to release new products and resolve issues that might arise.Reads and interprets schematics and drawings.Provides training to others on test procedures.Prepares failure analysis reports for customers as required.Reports any major production errors that would affect product quality.Competencies:Organizational SkillsThoroughness/Attention to detailResults-oriented, strategic thinker and plannerExceptional Communication Skills Supervisory Responsibility:This position does not have supervisory responsibilities. Work Environment:While performing the duties of this job, the employee can be exposed to moving parts and vibration. The noise level in the work environment can be medium. Physical demands:While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position requires sitting several hours at a time, in addition to walking, bending, kneeling and climbing stairs throughout the day. The employee must lift and/or move items up to 25lbs and occasionally up to 50lbs with assistance.Expected Hours of Work:This is a full-time position. Due to the nature of business this position must be able to work a flexible work schedule with varying hours. There is an expectation of working 45 hours a week. Overtime may be required depending on need. Travel:Occasional travel during the day may be necessary. Required Education and Experience:BS/BA in Engineering or AS/AA in Engineering Technology with 5+ years of relevant experienceExtensive test and troubleshooting experience.Proficient in the use of MS Office and computer hardware.Demonstrated experience in coding software utilizing Windows/other operating systems, SQL, Visual Basic, C, .Net, Labview or other software languages.Ability to use various test equipment to aid in troubleshooting.Preferred Education and Experience:BA/BS in Engineering or a related fieldElectronic manufacturing experience Familiarity with electrical CAD systems used to design and produce printed circuit boards.EEO Statement:It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all individuals. We are committed to a diverse workforce. We value all employees’ talents and support an environment that is inclusive and respectful. We are strongly committed to this policy and believe in the concept and spirit of the law.

title: Safety Software Engineer
job_description: OverviewWho we areCollaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.Who We’re Looking ForToyota’s Production Engineering Safety Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Safety Software Engineer.The primary responsibility of this role is to provide proactive safety support to the North American region. Areas of focus will include regional data visualization & dashboarding, support of software streamline activity, management of regional software kaizens/concerns, and monitoring progress toward KPI targets. Additional responsibilities will include support of new software implementation and monitoring the safety impact of new technologies.Reporting to the Safety Engineering Manager, the person in this role will support the Toyota Safety Department's objective to prioritize safety through standardization, achieve the best safety performance, and an incident-free workplace.What You’ll Be DoingRegional Data Visualization/DashboardingManage handover of PowerBI dashboarding responsibilities from a vendor to internal Toyota.Host weekly meetings with vendors to understand dashboard status and timelines; communicate these updates to dashboard stakeholders.Maintain & kaizen existing PowerBI dashboards for the Region.Develop new dashboards based on incoming requests from the Region.Prioritize & project manage the kaizen/new requests incoming from the Region.Develop training & upskill all regional safety members on existing dashboards in PowerBI & how to utilize.Conduct maintenance on Safety PowerBI & field questions/concerns from the Region.Track and report on ROI for dashboards and kaizen requests.Data Lake ManagementWork closely with IS to understand current gaps in data currently in the lake from multiple software’s & increase/kaizen to best support software connections & data visualizations.Handle all new data lake requests and updates.Manage ensuring new Safety Software data is properly in the data lake.Software Streamline ActivityMaintain field requests for & kaizen current Safety software based on needs from regional safety members, making sure they align with the Regional Software streamline activity.Support Software Lead on Regional Software streamlining activity.Lead data preparation & migration of existing software to ensure a smooth transition to new Safety software.Support new software deployments (communication development, scheduling, leading pilots, regional support training, etc.).Prepare standardized works & training materials for new software, as well as train all regional safety members on the use of new software.Work with Regional SMEs to build software requirements & ensure new safety software meets the needs of the customer.Support management of sunsetting existing software.Additional TasksManage AskSafety tickets and team.Upskill and manage SMEs for use of AskSafety.Support Software Governance Council.Work with IS to manage user concerns & facilitate countermeasures in TERA.Support development of the Safety Software Landing page.Work with IS & MDT to establish an organizational hierarchy tree for all of Manufacturing, SPO & TLS that aligns with safety Software.Work with DIME to support existing internal Toyota safety software (Digital Kanban, Shutdown Management, Safe Work Authorization, etc.).What You BringBatcheler Degree and/or 5+ years experience in Information Systems/Technology, Computer/Information Science, Business Analytics, or equivalent.Proficiency in Power BI development, data modeling, and data visualization concepts.Experience with data warehouse/data lake management.Demonstrated experience managing projects requiring critical thinking (kaizen), problem-solving, data analysis & verification.Added bonus if you haveMicrosoft Power BI Data Analyst Certification.Data Analytics Professional Certification (AWS, Google, IBM, SAS, etc.).Capable of developing and delivering presentations, generating effective reports, and conducting applicable standards research.Ability to generate business plans and strategies appropriate to the work assigned at the business unit level.What We’ll BringDuring your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.Vehicle purchase & lease programs.Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable).Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.Paid holidays and paid time off.Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more.Tax-Advantaged Accounts (Health Savings Account, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA).Belonging at ToyotaOur success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.Have a question or need assistance with your application? Please send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

title: Application Engineer
company: Lyons Mechanical Services - A Fidelity Company
job_description: Lyons Mechanical Services, a leading building automation company, is seeking a talented Application Engineer to join our team. If you are passionate about developing innovative software solutions for state-of-the-art building systems, this is the opportunity for you!Responsibilities Under minimal supervision, complete assigned projects, programming, and project turnover to commissioning process. Act as a technical resource to the project’s team and customer, as needed  Assist with solutions to systems problems, either troubleshooting the system or advising others on how to resolve problems  Familiarity with industrial communication protocols (Ethernet, I.P, Etc.)  Provide accurate information for closeout documents  Provide customer or end-user training on system operation  Collaborate with clients to gather feedback and make necessary adjustments to meet project goals.  Report problems or changes to supervisor or management  Perform self-study (reading, research, and practice) to obtain technical proficiency on required products and application  Lead, direct, and teach field technicians to assist in the successful implementation of projects  Adhere to safety standards and local and national codes with a high degree of regard for employee and subcontractor safety  Perform other duties as assigned Qualifications:2 or 4 year degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred but not required Knowledge of software and computer language used to operate Tridium Niagara Framework (Java/HTML). title: Web Developer
job_description: Kentucky Educational Television, (KET) has the following full-time position opening at its Lexington, Kentucky Network Center:Web DeveloperKET is Kentucky’s only statewide media organization, serving more than two million people each week with programs and services that educate, inform, and inspire. Full of charm and hospitality, you’ll find the region offers affordable living, outstanding educational opportunities, and world class sporting events.Do you have a passion for web development? title: CNC Programmer
job_description: Company DescriptionMUST be authorized to work in the United States for any employer.MUST be available to start working within 3 weeks of offer acceptance date.SEGULA TECHNOLOGIES is hiring a CNC Programmer to join our growing team in Lexington, KY.We offer a competitive salary and benefits plan, and great opportunities for career growth!With a global presence in 28 countries with DescriptionCollaborate with other Manufacturing Engineers, Industrial Engineers, Quality Engineers, and Production stakeholders to develop and maintain manufacturing process plans (MPP's) identifying strategies, NC Programs, and tool designs.Create/modify detailed work instructions, mfg. sketches, and other shop floor documentation to support production needs.Provide shopfloor support as necessary to resolve technical and manufacturing issues.Investigate and perform Root Cause analysis of component non-conformances and ensure implementation of effective Corrective Action.Monitor and report on quality, schedule, and cost performance of assigned projects/programs.Perform other duties as assigned.Willingness to learn and receive training, and when required, train others.QualificationsBachelor's degree from an accredited college in Engineering.Working experience utilizing PowerMill,TOP Solid V7, Vericut.Experience utilizing Vericut.Familiarity with ISO9000 and AS9100 industry standards.Effective project management.Good interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.Experience with precision machining (CNC lathes, CNC mills, etc.) capabilities, methods, cutting tools, and fixtures used to manufacture precision components made from aluminum alloys, stainless steel, titanium, and other common aerospace alloys.Experienced user of Computer Power Mill (CAD) software mandatory.Familiarity utilizing CAM software.Familiarity with G-code.Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) interpretation skills.Knowledge of precision measuring tools, gauges, and equipment.General understanding of Mil-Spec special processes (heat treatment, chem-film, anodize, passivation, organic coatings, etc.).Proficiency with Microsoft Office products.Must be eligible to work in the U.S.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Applications Engineer
job_description: Fives Group is seeking a Applications EngineerAbout Fives GroupFives Group, headquartered in Paris, France, is an industrial engineering group founded in 1812 that designs and supplies machines, process equipment and production lines for the world’s largest industrial groups including the aluminum, steel, tube and pipe, glass, automotive, aerospace, logistics, cement and energy sectors. In 2018, Fives achieved sales of $2 billion with a team of close to 8,500 employees and a network of over 100 operational units in over 25 countries. The Applications Engineer will design, plan, and coordinate the mechanical and software integration for machine components, controls and processes to deliver technology for our diverse customer base.Job ResponsibilitiesWorks closely with existing and new customers to identify new applications, markets and business opportunities for our processing equipment and technologies.Identifies opportunities to develop new types of processing systems based on market trends.Reviews and analyzes customer part manufacturing requirements.Prepares customer part simulations and reports using CAD and CAM software.Recommends machine type to best fit the customer needs.Makes visits to customer sites for technology introductions.Conducts presentations on equipment and technology resourcesThis position will require frequent travel of up to 50% to support new and existing business.QualificationsBachelor of Science in Engineering Degree or equivalent education and experience.Two or more years' experience in industrial manufacturing environment is preferredExperience in automated manufacturing equipment.SkillsKnowledgeable and proficient using engineering computer aided design tools. CATIA is the preferred CAD software for successful customer interaction but experience in other CAD systems (NX, Solidworks, etc.) will also be considered.Good organizational skills with focus on attention to details.Excellent communication skills - verbal, written, and presentation skills.Working knowledge of composites equipment and processing is helpfulMicrosoft office software proficiency.Benefits:Hired employees will receive great benefits along with an extremely competitive compensation package. Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, Holidays, Personal Time Off and 401K & IRA and more.

title: Game Developer
job_description: Sr. Game Developer - UnityLouisville, KYCharterDay-1 Onsite  Position Overview:We are seeking a skilled and experienced Unity Software Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Unity Software Developer, you will be responsible for developing and implementing interactive applications, games, and simulations using the Unity game engine. You will work closely with a multidisciplinary team, including artists, designers, and other developers, to create high-quality, engaging, and visually appealing experiences. Key Responsibilities:· Collaborate with the team to understand project requirements and design goals.· Develop interactive applications, games, and simulations using the Unity game engine.· Implement gameplay mechanics, user interfaces, and visual effects to create immersive experiences· Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code following industry best practices· Optimize performance and memory usage to ensure smooth and responsive applications.· Debug and resolve technical issues and bugs identified during testing and development.· Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance to ensure the reliability and stability of the applications.· Stay up-to-date with the latest Unity features, tools, and technologies and integrate them into the development process as appropriate.· Provide technical expertise and guidance to the team on Unity-related topics. Technical Skills Required:· Proficiency in Unity game engine and C# programming language.· Must have hands-on experience with ECS - Entity Component System.· Must have hands-on experience with DOTS - Data Oriented Technology Stack· GIS Application with MapBox Unity SDK· Experience with 3D modeling, animation, and physics systems within Unity. (A must)· Solid understanding of object-oriented programming principles and software design patterns.· Strong knowledge of game development concepts, including gameplay mechanics, collision detection, and physics simulation.· Familiarity with game development frameworks, tools, and workflows. Education and Experience:· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).· Proven experience in developing interactive applications or games using Unity.· A portfolio demonstrating your Unity projects or games is highly desirable. Competencies:· Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.· Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively communicate with team members.· Detail-oriented and committed to delivering high-quality work.· Excellent time management skills to meet project deadlines.· Flexibility and adaptability to changing project requirements and priorities.· Continuous learning mindset to stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in game development.· Good written and verbal communication skills.

Our team is fascinated by building technology to help fans get tickets in a more fun and affordable way.100s of thousands of sports fans and college students use our products every month to form friend groups, claim tickets to the upcoming games, and purchase season ticket packages through our fun, subscription plan offering. We’re the first to bring a Netflix style subscription to sports ticketing.As a Senior Full Stack Engineer at Season Share, you will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining full stack web apps.We Use React, NodeJS And MySQL Across Our Entire Product Suite. You Can Anticipate Working With The Following Technologies Day To DayReact/ReduxSQLMongoDBMochaJSExample Projects Of a Full Stack EngineerDesign user friendly features and productsReceive product requirements and design database models to facilitate business data flowWrite API endpoints consumed by front end React apps to facilitate new featuresWrite unit tests for your own endpointsIntegrate with third party REST APIsMake database design decisions new accommodate new featuresIntegrate with third party APIs that handle ticketing business logicAdd more features to the admin dashboard to make quality of life improvements for operations staffBonus PointsNatural leader with aspirations of becoming a manager and leading a teamWe are looking for a full time highly skilled Senior Full-Stack Engineer who is comfortable with both front and back end programming – preferably with expertise in and React.You will develop the future functionality of our product and be involved in the full development lifecycle. We are seeking a highly motivated individual who is comfortable in a fast-paced start-up environment as well as working with a remote development team. You will have the opportunity to work within a highly motivated and collaborative team.QualificationsWell rounded Full-Stack developer with exposure to all layers of application and developmentFront-end focused with designing productsExcellent development skills in and ReactProficiency with fundamental front end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavascripteCommerce experience (even as a hobby)Sports fanDeployed customer-facing software into a product environmentStrong analytical and critical thinkingGood communication skillsNice to haveFamiliarity with ReduxExperience with eCommerceEntrepreneurial mindset, can think in terms of product and from a sports fan perspective.

title: Application Engineer
job_description: IntroductionFives Intralogistics Corp is actively seeking an Application Engineer to join its teams in Louisville, KY.  At Fives, we are all driven by a common calling, to prove that industry can do it! We work  together daily to make industry an answer to all of the major technological,  environmental, social and economic challenges of our time. How do we do that? For over 200 years, we’ve invented and designed solutions and  technologies that substantially and sustainably improve everyone’s daily life. The Smart Automation Division of Fives specializes in providing smart, scalable, and future-proof solutions for sorting, handling, and advanced automation. The division has approximately 1,700 employees worldwide working in about 20 locations in Asia, Europe, and North America. Fives designs and supplies world-class material handling and sorting solutions for the Intralogistics sector to serve global leaders in the shipping industry such as Fed Ex, UPS, and DHL. The Group and its Intralogistics dedicated teams - around 500 people in France, Italy, China, Japan, Korea and the United States - automate internal logistics streams for postal and courier companies, distribution centers, and baggage handling systems.Job ContentPosition SummaryReviews customers’ requirements and proposes solutions to customer needs with regard to sorting systems. Manages activities as they relate to analyzing drawings, specifications, proposals, and other documentation to prepare time, cost, and labor estimates for products, projects, or services. Responsible for the technical solution for the project from concept to final acceptance by performing the following duties personally or through subordinates.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesAnalyses customer requests and proposes solutions to meet customer needs. Ensures that the solution being proposed to the customer is sound, competitive, and meets the specifications with respect to technical performance.Participate in customer meetings with sales to gather information and analyze the requirements.Review bids for specifications, acceptance criteria, and accuracy of the proposals to ensure the technical solution is properly represented.Advises Project Management and Senior Management on the ‘bid no bid’ process as to the feasibility of the customer request.Review and analyze proposals submitted to determine the beneficial derivatives and possible applications to justify expenditures.Review incoming proposals including contracts, terms and conditions, and statements of work to determine risk factors and areas of concern. Works with the project management and sales to create project budgets to minimize risks and protect gross margins.Responsible for proposal development as required, technical input, system description of operation (D of O), proposal manifest/equipment list, and all customer-required technical documents.Responsible for the acceptance testing procedure and terms proposed for the project. Also responsible for the final acceptance testing at the end of the project assigned. This includes field supervision of personnel and verification of the results.Implements methods and procedures for monitoring projects such as preparation of records of expenditures as well as Systems solutions, progress reports, and schedules to inform management of the current status of projects.Proposes new solutions and components for the Product Development Department to develop that would open new markets and or increase the competitiveness of the proposalsLeads and drives the estimating process through the organization.Works closely with operations, engineering, and sales teams to understand and help develop the best solution to meet the customers’ requirements and expectations.Conducts special studies to develop and establish standard hours and related cost data or effect cost reductions.Consult with clients, vendors, or other individuals to discuss and formulate estimates and resolve issues.Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree (B. S.) from a four-year College or university. A minimum of two years of related experience and/or training. Or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Knowledge in the distribution and order assembly process and/or knowledge in the postal sorting process and/or knowledge in the courier sorting process. Ability to use AutoCAD proficiently.

This is a Direct Hire opportunity.NOTE: This position requires US Citizenship or Permanent Residence.RESPONSIBILITIESWork, as part of an agile team, with the product owner, team members, and stakeholders to understand requirements for simple-to-complex business systems.Work with other agile team members to ensure that systems are being built to defined expectations and perform change management functions as needed.Analyze and perform modifications to systems as requested by end users.Analyze and assist in correction of problems which may occur in system operations.Actively supports and complies with all components of the compliance program, including, but not limited to, completion of training and reporting of suspected violations of law and company policy.Maintains confidentiality of all information; abides with HIPAA and PHI guidelines at all times. title: Software & Electronics Hardware Engineer -Laundry Team
job_description: Company:Midea is one of the world’s largest home appliance brands, offering the most comprehensive selection of products in the world to fully serve the needs of day-to-day living at home, at work, or anywhere else you go. In Europe, we strive to aim high, put the customer first, transform and innovate the marketplace, utilizing our commitment, dedication, inclusion and partnership with our teams. We are a global company with over 150,000 employees and operations in more than 195 countries. As a publicly listed company, we are also ranked #250 as a Fortune Global 500 company and offers one of the most comprehensive ranges in the home appliance industry.Summary:To continue to strengthen its base and support its growth in the US, Midea Laundry is extending its Research and Innovation capabilities. To lead this effort, Midea’s Appliance Division (LAD) has opened a new position for an Electronics Hardware Engineer. The Electronics Hardware Engineer is a key member of the R&D Team in the US, helping drive breakthroughs on product designs and functionality as well as evaluating product quality and field failures. The Software & Electronics Hardware Engineer will collaborate with other team members to design unique hardware and software solutions to progress innovative designs. In addition, the Engineer will conduct independent projects related to product development and quality improvement.The Software & Electronics Hardware Engineer will be responsible for supporting software & hardware development and strategic direction of the following products:Top Load Clothes WashersFront Load Clothes WashersClothes DryersEssential FunctionsResponsible for the decision-making, planning and review of electrical control laundry productsResponsible for solving PL, EMC and other related problems of electrical control laundry productsResponsible for improving software algorithm design and software development efficiency of electronicsResponsible for the formulation and writing of technical documents and standards related to electronicsGuide software and hardware design to carry out electrical control product reliability software and hardware design.Guide and develop innovation and analysis solutions for LAD US Division electronics innovations.Responsible for electrical control design work of Midea America Research Center Laundry division.Using and teaching hardware design tools: Schematic Capture, PCB Layout (we use AutoDesk Eagle)Use of hardware equipment: DMMs, Oscilloscope, Spectrum / Network Analyzers, Function Generators, Logic Analyzers, Serial bus debuggingAbility to generate new product & feature ideas and develop into working prototypes.Maintain a knowledge of marketplace and product trends, particularly regarding control systems.Ability to determine root cause failure analysis of field returned electronic hardware components.Collaborate with experts in China to maximize impact of projects.Other duties as assigned.QualificationsOver 10 years’ experience in technology, home appliance, CE, Ecommerce, or related industryBachelor of Science in Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineer with experience in software development or related, master’s degree preferred.Proficient in C, C++, GitHub, Linux, with years of embedded development experience with good coding principalsDesign experience with both analog and digital circuits.Embedded H/W & Software design experience for appliance applicationsKnowledge of multiple computing platforms, such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi, STM32, etc.Experience designing electronics, control systems, electro-mechanical component connection, embedded control modules, and wire harnesses.Familiar with the use of hardware development design tools, such as AD, PADS, Cadence, etc., to carry out PCB layout design.Experience with various serial buses, printed circuit board design and layout, microprocessors, power supply circuits, display, and cap-touch technology.Familiar with the use of hardware development design tools, such as AD, PADS, Cadence, etc., to carry out PCB layout design.Successful execution of complex projectsExcellent communication, motivation, and coordination skillsGoal oriented and self-managed personality with a strong entrepreneurial spiritStrong problem solving and risk management skills.Simulation Tools: SPICEPreferred Qualifications Experience with Linux or embedded RTOS.IoT experience which includes networking using Wi-Fi and/or Bluetooth.Graphical User Interface development experience.Midea America Corp, is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Senior Staff Scientist
job_description: OverviewWhy Valvoline Global Operations?Valvoline Global is a worldwide leader in automotive and industrial solutions, creating future-ready products and best-in-class services for partners around the globe. Established in 1866, we introduced the world’s first branded motor oil, claiming our position as The Original Motor Oil.As an affiliate of Aramco, one of the world's largest integrated energy and chemicals companies, we continue to invest strategically and expand globally, driving unparalleled product innovation and sustainable business solutions.Our corporate values of care, integrity, passion, and excellence shape everything we do. Living out our values is what makes our company, our employees, our partners, our customers, and the communities we serve great.When you join Valvoline Global, you join a culture that is committed to: treating all people with care, operating with integrity, striving for excellence in everything we do, and showing passion about delivering on our commitments.Careers for the DrivenValvoline has a rewarding opportunity as a Senior Staff Scientist. We whole-heartedly adopt a ‘never idle' mindset. We also know that outstanding service begins and ends with our employees. So, we’re looking for good people to join our team. You bring your skills, talents, and drive. We will give you a great place to work, a competitive salary and benefits, and the resources and support to develop and advance within our global company.How You’ll Make An ImpactThe Senior Staff Scientist will support the NPDL group in development of lubricants, coolants, and automotive chemicals products. Provides advanced analysis and troubleshooting support required by internal or external customers relating to automotive chemical product lines. In the role, you would be responsible for: Conducting work requiring independent judgment in the evaluation, selection, adaptation, and modification of standard techniques, processes, and criteria; refers to knowledge of precedents in the specialty area and principles and practice in related specialties.  Devising new approaches to problems encountered; works within conventional practices but may incorporate complex features; receives technical guidance on unusual or complex problems.  Designing, building and operating experimental rigs for testing lubricants and materials.  Conducting "hands on" theological and analytical testing of automotive chemicals in the laboratory.  Developing new technology for implementation in Valvoline® driveline products, coolant, brake and other services.  Performing advanced chemistry and tribology research for development of next generation automotive chemical products.  Providing technical expertise to support product improvement by working in conjunction with internal groups, OEM customers, government agency and leading universities.  Planning, scheduling, conducting, or coordinating detailed phases of work for a part of a major project or total project of moderate scope.  Generating product claims data via lab, bench, engine or field testing to leverage Valvoline's technology advantages across entire product line.  Providing work direction to lab scientist(s) and mentor to support their career development.  Providing advanced analysis and troubleshooting support required by internal or external customers relating to automotive chemical product lines.  Conducting research effectively by maintaining accurate records of experiments and analyses performed, conducting relevant literature searches, and maintaining an up-to-date knowledge of all current methods of experimentation. What You’ll Need MS in Mechanical Engineering or a closely related field such as Material Engineering, Automotive Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or Chemistry  Minimum 5 years of experience preferred in the following areas: Theoretical and experimental analysis and application of hydrocarbons as cleaners/degreasers  Numerical modeling of mechanical system  Automotive chemical formulations  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Multi-tasker and problem-solver  Familiarity with Engine/Transmission hardware, operation and design  Attention to detail and desire to complete quality work products  Ability to work well with others and comprehend instruction quickly  Knowledge of Engine and Transmission Performance Testing  Knowledge of oil specifications and qualification procedures is advantageous  Experience with analytical test methods and laboratory methods  Computer Skills - specifically Excel, Power Point, SAP and QC software  Travel is required to perform some responsibilities of position (up to 10%)  Must be authorized to work in the U.S. What Will Set You Apart PhD preferred  Experience formulating finished lubricants, either for an oil marketer, additive supplier or base oil manufacturer Benefits That Drive Themselves Health insurance plans (medical, dental, vision)  HSA and flexible spending accounts  401(k)  Incentive opportunity*  Life insurance  Short and long-term disability insurance  Paid vacation and holidays*  Employee Assistance Program  Employee discounts  Tuition reimbursement*  Adoption assistance* Terms and conditions apply, and benefits may differ depending on position. Valvoline provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Are you good at what you do? Join us.The Company endeavors to make its recruitment process accessible to any and all users. Reasonable accommodations will be provided, upon request, to applicants with disabilities in order to facilitate equal opportunity throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact Human Resources at 1-800-Valvoline or email 1-800Valvoline@valvoline.com to make a request for reasonable accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment and selection process. The contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Systems Engineer, Enterprise
job_description: Company DescriptionThis role will be remote out of Kentucky.Our MissionAt Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.Our Approach to WorkWe lead with flexibility and choice in all of our people programs. We have disrupted the traditional view that all employees have the same needs and wants. We offer personalization and offer our employees the opportunity to choose what works best for them as often as possible - from your wellbeing support to your growth and development, and beyond!Job DescriptionYour CareerAs a Systems Engineer you provide technical expertise and guidance in your customer’s zero trust journey. You will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security services that establish PANW as your customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.Your ImpactRoleCuriosity is core to the SE role, and you see complex problems as opportunities to learn and deliver innovative solutions! You define your impact by:Meeting and exceeding sales quotas by building and implementing strategic, technical account plans that target cross-platform solutions Conducting discovery to understand and articulate the key technical, operational, and commercial imperatives of your prospects and customersPlanning and building compelling technical and business-focused solutions which drive adoption and growth after the initial sale and across the portfolioDemonstrating strong communication skills and the ability to influence through effective presentations and customer-specific demos, technical engagements, and workshopsOrchestrating supporting resources to ensure a one-team approach that demonstrates a cohesive strategyPromoting end-to-end solutions that include PANW and/or partner professional services to ensure customers realize business value soonerUnderstanding the competitive landscape and effectively differentiate our leadership Continuously investing in yourself to develop technical and professional skills that drive your ever-increasing contributions to customer success while actively participating within the SE community and at industry eventsQualificationsYour Experience4+ years of experience as a successful pre-sales SE, systems integrator, or equivalent experienceUnderstanding of data networkingDelivering cybersecurity solutions that solve technical challenges and influence new business initiativesInfluencing and gaining buy-in from key stakeholders, either in a customer-facing or internal role - prior experience in a pre-sales role is idealCreating and delivering technical presentations, workshops, or technical validation engagements Experience selling, implementing, or managing SaaS/SASE/cloud/managed/on-prem offerings is a plusPartnering with Customer Support functions to ensure successful implementation and adoption of sold solutionsComplex sales involving long sales processes with multiple buying centers and multi-product solutions is preferredAdditional InformationThe TeamOur SE team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Systems Engineering community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.Our CommitmentWe’re trailblazers who dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: We can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $192,000/yr to $264,000/yr. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.Is role eligible for Immigration Sponsorship?: No. Please note that we will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.

title: Test Engineer
job_description: About Wipro:Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. title: Senior Engineer
job_description: DescriptionTempur Sealy is committed to improving the sleep of more people, every night, all around the world. As a leading designer, manufacturer, distributor, and retailer of bedding products worldwide, we know how crucial a good night of sleep is to overall health and wellness. Utilizing over a century of knowledge and industry-leading innovation, we deliver award-winning products that provide breakthrough sleep solutions to consumers in over 100 countries. Our highly recognized brands include Tempur-Pedic®, Sealy® and Stearns & Foster®. We hire people who have a passion for helping others find their best night’s sleep. No matter what stage of your career, you can build your future at Tempur Sealy!Our Company Offers Great Benefits, IncludingGenerous Paid Time OffCompetitive Medical, Dental & other wellness programsDisability and Life Company PaidRetirement Plan OptionsGenerous Employee Purchase Discounts Pay Range: $76,000-$109,000What You’ll Do (Essential Duties And Responsibilities)Perform specialized engineering tasks and functions within a certain engineering area: Operations Excellence, Process, Manufacturing, Controls, Product, or Chemical. Complete, provide engineering leadership to, and support projects within one of the defined engineering areas. Ensure that all work, or work performed under your supervision, meets or exceeds the highest professional and company standards. Continuously look for ways to improve the engineering process to gain efficiencies in cost and production. Collaborate with other engineering teams to develop and implement engineering best practices at all company locations. Ensure that all equipment under your supervision is functioning properly and most efficiently.Manage and lead the implementation of new equipment or procedures. Assist with regular production process audits (equipment and products) to find production and cost inefficiencies. Develop and implement solutions for inefficiencies and deficiencies discovered in audits.Manage and lead regular safety audits to ensure the highest levels of safety are being maintained.Lead the engineering aspects of new product development and production. Provide input and feedback to the relevant product development teams about current or potential products. title: Node.JS Developer with MongoDB
job_description: Node.JS Developer with MongoDBLouisville KYOnsite-day 1Description:This Node.js Software Developer IV for the engineering platform will play a pivotal role in developing and enhancing high-performance applications and services. The expertise in Node.js and MongoDB, coupled with additional desirable skills, will drive the platform's evolution and functionality. Collaborating with our dedicated team, you will leverage technology to maintain and extend Charter Communications' leadership in the telecommunications sector.  Key Responsibilities: • Design and develop scalable backend services and APIs for the Magellan engineering platform using Node.js. • Lead MongoDB integration and optimization efforts, focusing on platform performance and scalability. • Work alongside front-end developers and system architects to ensure a cohesive user experience across the platform. • Implement software development best practices, including code refactoring, unit testing, and continuous integration to maintain code quality and application performance. • Engage in code reviews and provide mentorship to junior developers, promoting a culture of continuous improvement and learning. • Explore and integrate new technologies and methodologies, such as AWS for cloud services and graph databases for complex data relationships. • Stay abreast of the latest trends in software development, network engineering technologies, and microservices architecture to enhance the Magellan platform.  Qualifications: • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience. • Minimum of 6 years of extensive experience with Node.js, specifically in developing scalable web applications and APIs. • Demonstrated proficiency with MongoDB; experience with graph databases is highly desired. • Strong skills in code refactoring, unit testing, and ensuring code quality through best practices. • Knowledge of Unity (game engine) is considered a strong asset. • Proven track record of conducting code reviews and mentoring junior developers. • Solid understanding and practical experience with microservices architecture is desired. • Experience with AWS and familiarity with cloud services and infrastructure is desired. • Proficiency in Angular or other front-end technologies is highly desired. • Experience with TypeScript is a plus. • Ability to work in an evolving environment and collaborate effectively with a team. • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to new technologies and methodologies quickly.

title: System Development Engineer
job_description: DescriptionAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? We apply advances in robotics and software to solve real-world problems that delight our customers' experiences in ways we can't even imagine yet.Amazon Robotics is located in the greater Boston area, the epicenter of robotics innovation. Our diverse, collaborative team of engineers come from all over the world to design, test and build our dynamic fleet of robots and mechatronic systems. Having our offices, labs, test floors and factories all co-located means that we can design the hardware, write the code, test, build and watch it all come to life. This allows us to innovate quickly and on limitless ideas. Current advancements are underway in autonomous movement and mobility, artificial intelligence and machine learning, manipulation, simulation, robotic management software, predictive analytics, and much more.We are looking for a Systems Development Engineer who will actively support and foster a culture of inclusion and be a key contributor to designing, developing and supporting our complex infrastructure environment across a diverse set of technologies and applications. This role will provide exposure to cutting edge technology including an ecosystem of robotics, industrial IoT, sensors, drones, and mobile devices. The right candidate will be able to identify and resolve issues, automate processes, maintain service infrastructure, and work closely with cross departmental teams to achieve business objectives while ensuring platform security, reliability, and supportability. The ideal candidate will have experience working with Windows, Linux and cloud platforms such as AWS, preferably in large scale, distributed environments.Key job responsibilities Actively support and foster a culture of inclusion Participate in on call rotation for infrastructure related coverage Implement scalable distributed systems in AWS. Provide troubleshooting and problem solving for platform and application issues Deliver OS patching in addition to platform and application updates Setup and maintain automated solutions for testing, alerting and monitoring Create and maintain deployments for platform management/administration automation with scripting in Perl, Python, JAVA, etc.A day in the lifeAmazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) PlanIf you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you’re passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Campbellsville, KY, USABasic Qualifications 1+ years of experience with Linux and Windows server administration 1+ years working within virtualization or cloud environments 1+ years systems engineering experience 1+ years of systems management/administration automation in Perl, Python, JAVA or similar technologiesPreferred Qualifications 1+ years working on large-scale distributed systems 1+ years of experience with AWS services such as: VPC, EC2, S3, RDS and SES/SMTP on production workloads 1+ years of experience using, designing, and/or implementing system health and performance monitoring tools 1+ years of experience with security concepts such as: network security, application security, security protocols, cryptography, etc. 1+ years of experience using Agile software development practices Demonstrated problem solving skills with a strong attention to detail Experience using, implementing or managing configuration management platformsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  DescriptionAre you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? We apply advances in robotics and software to solve real-world problems that delight our customers' experiences in ways we can't even imagine yet.Amazon Robotics is located in the greater Boston area, the epicenter of robotics innovation. Our diverse, collaborative team of engineers come from all over the world to design, test and build our dynamic fleet of robots and mechatronic systems. Having our offices, labs, test floors and factories all co-located means that we can design the hardware, write the code, test, build and watch it all come to life. This allows us to innovate quickly and on limitless ideas. Current advancements are underway in autonomous movement and mobility, artificial intelligence and machine learning, manipulation, simulation, robotic management software, predictive analytics, and much more.We are looking for a Systems Development Engineer who will actively support and foster a culture of inclusion and be a key contributor to designing, developing and supporting our complex infrastructure environment across a diverse set of technologies and applications. This role will provide exposure to cutting edge technology including an ecosystem of robotics, industrial IoT, sensors, drones, and mobile devices. The right candidate will be able to identify and resolve issues, automate processes, maintain service infrastructure, and work closely with cross departmental teams to achieve business objectives while ensuring platform security, reliability, and supportability. The ideal candidate will have experience working with Windows, Linux and cloud platforms such as AWS, preferably in large scale, distributed environments.Key job responsibilities Actively support and foster a culture of inclusion Participate in on call rotation for infrastructure related coverage Implement scalable distributed systems in AWS. Provide troubleshooting and problem solving for platform and application issues Deliver OS patching in addition to platform and application updates Setup and maintain automated solutions for testing, alerting and monitoring Create and maintain deployments for platform management/administration automation with scripting in Perl, Python, JAVA, etc.A day in the lifeAmazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include: Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Maternity and Parental Leave Options Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) PlanIf you are not sure that every qualification on the list above describes you exactly, we'd still love to hear from you! At Amazon, we value people with unique backgrounds, experiences, and skillsets. If you're passionate about this role and want to make an impact on a global scale, please apply!We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:Campbellsville, KY, USABasic Qualifications 1+ years of experience with Linux and Windows server administration 1+ years working within virtualization or cloud environments 1+ years systems engineering experience 1+ years of systems management/administration automation in Perl, Python, JAVA or similar technologiesPreferred Qualifications 1+ years working on large-scale distributed systems 1+ years of experience with AWS services such as: VPC, EC2, S3, RDS and SES/SMTP on production workloads 1+ years of experience using, designing, and/or implementing system health and performance monitoring tools 1+ years of experience with security concepts such as: network security, application security, security protocols, cryptography, etc. 1+ years of experience using Agile software development practices Demonstrated problem solving skills with a strong attention to detail Experience using, implementing or managing configuration management platformsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
